Hello Jekyll

Feb 15, 2014

My new personal website is finally up and running.

Been thinking of switching to Jekyll for a long time. With Jekyll, you transform plain text (Markdown in my case) into static websites and blogs. You can either decide to publish such a site on your own server, but most of the hipsters around use GitHub Pages to host their personal sites. So do I now. It’s definitely something for hackers but the benefits are great once you made yourself comfortable with it. There are countless tutorials and experience reports for Jekyll/GH-Pages out there, no need for me to redo the same thing over and over again. However, if you’re a geek like me, you should consider giving it a go.

Jekyll is extensible with plugins. It’s also pretty easy to achieve syntax highlighting with Jekyll. Here is Hello World in Ruby.

puts 'Hello world'

Not bad, eh? It’s not as awesome as Sushi and retro consoles, but well… nearly.
